name: Potassium Chloride
indications: potassium chloride extended-release tablets indicated treatment prophylaxis hypokalemia without metabolic alkalosis , patients dietary management potassium-rich foods diuretic dose reduction insufficient .
contraindications: monitor serum potassium adjust dosages accordingly ( 2.1 ) serum potassium less 2.5 meq/l , intravenous potassium instead oral supplementation ( 2.1 ) take meals glass water liquid . swallow tablets whole without crushing , chewing sucking . ( 2.1 ) treatment hypokalemia : doses range 40 to100 meq/day divided doses . limit doses 40 meq per dose . ( 2.2 ) prevention hypokalemia : typical dose 20 meq per day . ( 2.2 )
warningsAndPrecautions: potassium chloride extended-release tablets , usp contain 600 mg 750 mg potassium chloride , usp ( equivalent 8 meq 10 meq respectively ) , provided extended release tablets . table 1 : supplied dose shape color debossment blistercards 30 tablets blistercards 15 tablets blistercards 14 tablets 600 mg ( 8 meq ) round white off-white “ yh ” “ 106 ” one side , “ 8 ” side n/a n/a n/a 750 mg ( 10 meq ) round white off-white “ yh ” “ 105 ” one side , “ 10 ” side 0615-8570-39 0615-8570-05 0615-8570-14 store 20° 25°c ( 68° 77°f ) ; excursions permitted 15° 30°c ( 59° 86°f ) [ usp controlled room temperature . ] protect light moisture . dispense tight container defined usp child-resistant closure .
adverseReactions: potassium chloride contraindicated patients triamterene amiloride .
indications_original: Potassium Chloride Extended-Release Tablets are indicated for the treatment and prophylaxis of hypokalemia with or without metabolic alkalosis, in patients for whom dietary management with potassium-rich foods or diuretic dose reduction is insufficient.
contraindications_original:
Monitor serum potassium and adjust dosages accordingly
  
     (2.1) If serum potassium is less than 2.5 mEq/L, use intravenous potassium instead of oral supplementation
  
     (2.1) Take with meals and with a glass of water or other liquid. Swallow tablets whole without crushing, chewing or sucking.
  
     (2.1) Treatment of hypokalemia : Doses range from 40 to100 mEq/day in divided doses. Limit doses to 40 mEq per dose. (2.2) Prevention of hypokalemia : Typical dose is 20 mEq per day. (2.2)
warningsAndPrecautions_original:
Potassium Chloride Extended-Release Tablets, USP contain 600 mg or 750 mg of Potassium Chloride, USP (equivalent to 8 mEq and 10 mEq respectively), and are provided as extended release tablets.

                    Store at 20° to 25°C (68° to 77°F); excursions permitted to 15° to 30°C (59° to 86°F) [See USP Controlled Room Temperature.] Protect from light and moisture.

                  Dispense in a tight container as defined in the USP with a child-resistant closure.
adverseReactions_original: Potassium chloride is contraindicated in patients on triamterene and amiloride.
